scene.meta: McCROSKEY Looks like I picked the wrong week to quit amphetamines. He pops a couple pills. Fifteen REPORTERS, Cameramen, etc. enter with Air Controller #l.
scene.dialogue: (to McCroskey) Steve, these reporters won't leave without a statement.
How much longer can the sick passengers hold out?
scene.meta: McCROSKEY Half hour...maybe forty-five minutes.
scene.dialogue: Who's flying the plane?
scene.meta: Air Controller #2 enters and hands McCroskey a note. Hands holding microphones are thrust INTO FRAME in front of McCroskey. One hand is holding an ice cream cone. McCROSKEY One of the passengers. But he's an experienced air force pilot who flew during the war so there's no cause for alarm. Hinshaw, take over. McCroskey exits.
scene.dialogue: Have the families been notified?
I think Florence Henderson knows about it!
What are the chances of bringing this plane in safely?
What are the chances of returning something to Montgomery Ward the week after Christmas?
(beckoning to door) All right, boys. Let's get some pictures.
scene.meta: Three men with cameras enter and begin to remove framed pictures from walls.
scene.dialogue: coming off press. SUPERIMPOSE:
Series of spinning newspapers. CAMERA ZOOMS IN to each as it stops spinning so that we can read headlines. Headlines are:
scene.meta: "CHICAGO TIMES" "DISASTER LOOMS FOR AIRLINE PASSENGERS" "NEW YORK TRIBUNE" "CHICAGO PREPARES FOR CRASH LANDING" "NATIONAL INQUIRER" "BOY TRAPPED IN REFRIGERATOR EATS OWN FOOT" CAMERA ZOOMS in to:
SPINNING TELEVISION SET
scene.dialogue: Striken Airliner Approaches Chicago!
Arab newcast.
Japanese newscast.

NEWSCASTER is an African in native dress with a bone in his nose. There is a graphic of an airplane behind him and he is beating on a hollow log with sticks. The CAMERA ANGLE CHANGES and he switches to look into NEW CAMERA, and continues beating.
scene.meta: CBS' SIXTY MINUTES "POINT-COUNTERPOINT" SET
scene.dialogue: Shana, they bought their tickets, they knew what they were getting into. I say, let 'em crash!

scene.meta: SCREAMING firetrucks, police cars, and ambulances.
Lightning and THUNDER.

scene.dialogue: Will the hospital equipment be at the airport?
Yes, everything they've got. How are the passengers doing?
I won't deceive you, Mister Striker. We're running out of time.
Surely there must be something you can do.
I'm doing everything I can! -- And stop calling me Shirley!
scene.meta: Rumack leaves.
scene.dialogue: I've got to stay calm. If I can just keep my wits about me, I can't mess this one up.
Maybe I have been too harsh with him. If I had given him more support in the beginning, maybe things would be different.
Forget it. It's not your fault.
That's sweet of you, Ted. I appreciate the thought.
scene.meta: We hear both of their thoughts simultaneously.
STRIKER'S ELAINE'S
scene.dialogue: You know, Elaine, I just It's just that I feel so wanted to tell you... helpless and...
Go ahead.
No, no. You were first.

scene.sceneheader: INT. PASSENGER CABIN - ANOTHER AREA - NIGHT
scene.meta: Jack is seated across the aisle from Mrs. Hammen. He falls asleep and slumps over.
scene.dialogue: (hysterically) He's dead. He's dead!
scene.meta: Jack wakes up. Disgustedly:
scene.dialogue: No, I'm not dead.

scene.sceneheader: INT. PASSENGER CABIN - ANOTHER AREA - NIGHT
scene.meta: Mrs. Schiff is holding the bottle to her shoulder and patting it. It BURPS.
Sister Angelina is singing to the two black dudes.
scene.dialogue: 'What you want, Baby I got, What you need, You know I got it. All I'm askin' for Is a little respect When you come home.'

scene.sceneheader: INT. PASSENGER CABIN - STEWARDESS' ALCOVE - NIGHT
scene.meta: Rumack pours a cup of water. Randy begins to weep.
scene.dialogue: Randy, are you all right?
Doctor Rumack, I'm scared. I've never been so scared. And besides, I'm twenty-six and I'm not married.
Randy, we're going to make it. You've got to believe that.
scene.meta: Mrs. Hammen enters alcove.
scene.dialogue: Lorison, do you have any idea when we'll be landing?
It will be pretty soon. How are you bearing up?
Well, to be honest, I'm very scared. But at least I've got a husband.

scene.meta: Revolving radar antenna.
of typewriter. CAMERA PULLS OUT to REVEAL Dispatcher typing message.
scene.dialogue: National Weather Service reporting Chicago ceiling zero, visibility one hundred feet.
scene.meta: With great care the Dispatcher turns the knob on carriage until the paper comes out clean. Relishing his victory, he talks in Donald Duck voice.
scene.dialogue: Oh boy, oh boy, oh boy.
scene.meta: As he starts toward the door, the room caves in on him.

McCroskey and Kramer are at watercooler. McCroskey is filling cup while Kramer drinks. McCROSKEY Rex, I've decided that the best thing to do is to foam the runway -- let him do a wheels-up landing. It'd be a lot simpler. Kramer throws cup into wastebasket. McCroskey drinks.
scene.dialogue: (filling up another cup) No, the risk of fire is too great. If she starts burning, you write off all those people who can't get out of there on their own power.
scene.meta: McCroskey throws cup into wastebasket. Kramer drinks. McCROSKEY (filling up another cup) Well that's better than writing them all off? Are you going to play God with a hundred and 38 lives? Kramer throws cup into wastebasket as McCroskey drinks.
scene.dialogue: (filling up another cup) No. A belly landing isn't all that simple. It takes a good pilot to keep from smearin' himself all over the runway.
scene.meta: McCroskey throws cup into wastebasket as Kramer drinks. McCROSKEY (filling up another cup) If Striker has the guts to try this, he deserves the best shot we can give him. We've gotta foam that runway. Kramer throws cup into wastebasket as McCroskey drinks.
scene.dialogue: (taking another cup) His only shot's with the wheels down. I've seen foam tear a man's guts out.
scene.meta: McCroskey throws cup into wastebasket. Kramer throws cup into wastebasket. McCROSKEY And if Striker goes to pieces?
scene.dialogue: (taking another cup) That's a risk we'll just have to take.
scene.meta: Kramer throws cup into wastebasket. McCroskey throws cup into wastebasket. They burp.
Striker is looking at controls. Lightning is flashing on his face.
scene.dialogue: SUPERIMPOSE fighter plane. Then STOCK FOOTAGE of early experimental planes crashing.
Stay in formation. Targets just ahead. Target should be clear it you go in low enough. You'll have to decide. (echoing) You'll have to decide. You'll have to decide...So, decide already.

scene.meta: Sudden dramatic MUSIC. The cockpit shakes. Engine number three is flaming out.
INSERT - CONTROL PANEL - GAUGE FOR ENGINE #3
BACK TO SCENE
scene.dialogue: Rats! I've lost number three.
What happened, Ted? What went wrong?
Oil pressure. I forgot to check the oil pressure. When Kramer hears about this, the shit's gonna hit the fan.

scene.meta: The shit hits it. PULL BACK to include:
scene.dialogue: I told him to watch that oil temperature. What the hell's he doing up there?
scene.meta: He picks up the mike.
scene.dialogue: Striker, that plane can't land itself! It takes a pilot who can handle pressure.
scene.meta: McCROSKEY Ease up, Rex! He hasn't flown for years! It's not his fault. It could happen to any pilot.
scene.dialogue: It happened to Barbara Stanwyck!
He's right. I can't take the pressure. I was crazy to think I could land this plane.
But Ted, you're the only...
I don't care. I just don't have what it takes. They'd be better off with someone who'd never flown before.
scene.meta: As Striker leaves he puts autopilot into pilot's seat. Elaine is on the verge of tears. DRAMATIC MUSIC.
Air Controller #2 enters.
scene.dialogue: Bad news. The fog's getting thicker.
And Liz Taylor is getting larger!
scene.meta: McCROSKEY Ya know, this would be a tough landing for anyone to make. Maybe, if we hold them off for a bit we'll get a break in the weather.
scene.dialogue: All right, but let's wait until they reach the control area.

scene.meta: THUNDER and lightning.
Outside stewardess' alcove. Striker fills a cup from drinking fountain then pours it on his head. He sits down dejectedly on stewardess' fold-out seat. Rumack approaches.
scene.dialogue: I know what you're going to say, so save your breath.
scene.meta: Rumack sits.
scene.dialogue: No. I haven't a thing to say. You've done the best you could. You really have. The best you could. I guess we can't expect to win 'em all. I want to tell you something I've kept to myself for years. I was in the war myself -- the Medical Corps. I was on duty late one night when a badly wounded pilot was brought in from a raid. He could barely talk, but he looked at me and he said, "Doc. The odds were against us up there but we went in anyway, and I'm glad we did. The captain made the right decision." The pilot's name was George Zipp.
scene.meta: Striker looks up. Notre Dame Fight Song is heard in b.g.
scene.dialogue: George Zipp said that?

And the last thing he said to me, "Doc," he said, "Sometime when the crew is up against it and the breaks are beating the boys, tell them to go out there with all they've got and win just one for the Zipper. I don't know where I'll be then, Doc," he said, "but I won't smell too good. That's for sure."
(rejuvinated) Excuse me, Doc, I've got a plane to land.
scene.meta: Striker boldly starts toward cockpit.
Striker enters. Elaine, unaware of his return, is listening to Kramer on the radio.
scene.dialogue: All right, you'd better stay up there for a bit. As soon as the fog lifts, we'll bring you in.
I'll take it, Elaine.
scene.meta: She turns to face him. A dramatic moment. Striker enters pilot seat and takes mike from Elaine's hand.
scene.dialogue: Listen to me, Kramer. Doctor Rumack says the sick people are in critical condition and every minute counts. We've got to land now!
Don't be a fool, Striker. You know what a landing like this means. You more than anybody. I'm ordering you to stay up there!
No dice, Chicago. I'm giving the orders, and we're coming in...I guess the foot's on the other hand now, isn't it, Kramer?

scene.meta: McCROSKEY He'll never bring it down in this soup. Never! Not one chance in a million.
scene.dialogue: I know. I know. But it's his ship now, his command; he's in charge, he's the boss, the head man, the top dog, the big cheese, the head honcho...
scene.meta: Air Controller #2 rushes up to McCroskey and Kramer, carrying a newspaper.
scene.dialogue: Chief, look at this!
scene.meta: Kramer grabs newspaper.
scene.dialogue: (reading) 'Passengers Certain to Die?!?!?!?!?!'
scene.meta: McCROSKEY 'Airline Negligent?!?!?!?!?!' He hands the paper to Hinshaw.
scene.dialogue: (looking at newspaper) There's a sale at Penny's!
scene.meta: McCroskey grabs paper from Hinshaw.
scene.dialogue: (to men in Dispatch) All right, I'll need three men up in the tower. (pointing) You, Neubauer. You, Macias.
Me John. Big tree.
scene.meta: He puts his ear to the ground.
scene.dialogue: Wagon train comes three, maybe four day away.
(into microphone) Stand by, Striker. I'm going to the tower. And good luck.
scene.meta: Kramer exits. McCROSKEY (into phone) We're going to the tower. McCroskey exits.
scene.dialogue: (excitedly) The tower! Oh! Rapunzel! Rapunzel!

scene.meta: THUNDER and lightning.
Randy is talking to passengers and demonstrating.
scene.dialogue: In a moment we'll ask you to assume crash positions. Your life jackets are located under your seat.

scene.sceneheader: INT. PASSENGER CABIN - ANOTHER AREA - NIGHT
scene.meta: Jack and Shirley are watching.
scene.dialogue: Remove the jacket and unfold it so that the red arrow points up.

scene.sceneheader: INT. PASSENGER CABIN - ANOTHER AREA - NIGHT
scene.meta: The Krishnas are watching.
scene.dialogue: Place the jacket over your head, and when I give the word pull the cord under the left side flap.
She pulls the cord and it inflates into a child's duck- shaped inner tube.

scene.meta: Hinshaw, Kramer, and McCroskey enter. Three Controllers are there. One is wearing a black striped shirt.
scene.dialogue: We're all ready, sir.
scene.meta: As he makes introductions, they shake hands.
scene.dialogue: Captain McCroskey, this is Captain Roberts. Captain Kramer, this is Captain Colosimo. Captain Hinshaw, Captain Gatz. Captain Kramer, Captain Gatz. Captain Hinshaw, Captain Roberts.
All right. Colosimo, you'll work the relay. Roberts, double check all air traffic within five miles.
scene.meta: Roberts is scratching his ear.
scene.dialogue: And get that finger out of your ear. You don't know where that finger's been! Gunderson?
Yes, Captain?
Did you decide on a runway yet?
Runway niner. It's the longest, and directly into the wind.
And the foliage looks so pretty this time of year.
scene.meta: Gunderson exits.
scene.dialogue: (into mike) Striker, you're going to have to work fast. After this message, do not acknowledge any transmission unless you want to ask a question. Do you understand? Striker, Striker, do you read me?

scene.meta: Mrs. Oveur enters.
scene.dialogue: Steve!
scene.meta: McCROSKEY Linda, your husband and the others are alive but unconscious.
scene.dialogue: Just like Gerald Ford!
scene.meta: McCROSKEY Now there's a chance we can save them if Striker can get this plane down on time.
scene.dialogue: That isn't much of a chance, is it?
(appalled) Where did you get that dress? It's an eye- sore!

scene.meta: Gunderson and an assistant are seated in front of radar screens. One of them is a video anti-aircraft game.
scene.dialogue: (into microphone) Eight miles. Turn right to heading zero eight niner.
(into microphone) You are now eight miles from the airport. Turn right to a heading of zero eight niner, throttle back slightly and begin to lose altitude to fifteen hundred feet.
We're now at twelve hundred feet, leveling off.
(to McCroskey) Steve, I want every light you can get poured on that field.
scene.meta: McCROSKEY It's being done right now.
A truck is dumping a variety of lamps, fixtures, and light bulbs onto the runway.

scene.dialogue: (into mike) Tower to all emergency vehicles. Runway is niner.

scene.meta: Ambulances, fire trucks, and police cars start to move.
scene.dialogue: (over P.A.) Airport vehicles take positions one and two.
(into microphone) Civilian equipment, number three.

scene.meta: Ambulances, firetrucks, and police cars speed toward runway. They are followed by a baggage truck, fuel truck, a taxi, Coke truck, an ice cream truck, farm machinery, and a cement mixer.
scene.dialogue: (over P.A.) Air Force positions number four and five. All ambulances to position three.
(into mike) It's a twister! It's a twister! Toto!... Auntie Em!

scene.meta: THUNDER and lightning.

scene.dialogue: All right, Striker, put down twenty degrees of flap. When your flaps are down, retrim for level flight.

scene.meta: Passengers are wearing headsets and watching in-flight movie. Randy approaches Mrs. Schiff.
scene.dialogue: Stewardess, how soon 'til we land?
It won't be long now. Try not to worry.
scene.meta: Mrs. Schiff puts on a headset and watches movie. The movie is airplanes crashing and burning.
flying erratically.
scene.dialogue: fluctuating.

scene.meta: A woman, applying facial makeup, smears it all over her face.

scene.dialogue: He's all over the place! Nine hundred feet up to thirteen hundred feet! What an asshole!
Watch your altitude, Striker. It's too erratic. You can't come straight in. You've got enough fuel left for two hours flying. You've got to stay up there 'til we get a break in the weather.

scene.meta: Striker reaches for microphone.
scene.dialogue: I'll take it, Elaine. (into mike) Listen, Kramer, I'm coming in. Do you hear me? I'm coming in right now! We have people up here who will die in less than an hour, never mind two. I may bend your precious airplane, but I'll get it down! Now get on with the landing check. I'm putting the gear down now.
scene.meta: As he activates landing gear, Randy enters.
scene.dialogue: Mr. Striker, the passengers are ready.
Thank you, Randy. You better leave sweetheart. You might get hurt in here.
scene.meta: Randy leaves. There is a CRASH and Randy screams.
scene.dialogue: Ted...
Yes?
I wanted you to know -- now -- I'm very proud.
Tell them the gear is down and we're ready to land.
(into mike) The gear is down.
And we're ready to land.
scene.meta: McCROSKEY He may not be able to fly, but he's sure got guts. Kramer nods.

scene.sceneheader: EXT. LAX PASSENGER LOADING AREA - BUSINESSMAN - NIGHT
scene.meta: in Striker's cab cheeks his watch.
scene.dialogue: Well, I'll give him another twenty minutes, but that's it.

scene.meta: Fog, THUNDER, and lightning.

scene.dialogue: I'm sure we'll both make it...but just in case one of us...well, is there a message you'd like me to give someone?
No. I'm all alone.
Just in case I don't have a chance to say goodbye, I want you to know that I haven't spent so many pleasant hours for many years.
That's a very nice compliment, and I'd like to say that...you've done the same for me.

scene.meta: Dr. Rumack pokes his head in the door.
scene.dialogue: I just wanted to tell you both good luck. We're all counting on you.
Now, Striker...hold your present heading, put down full flap, bring your air speed back to a hundred and thirty-five, then I want you to take hold of the throttle...
And stick it in your ear.
And stick it in your ear.
scene.meta: McCroskey gives Hinshaw a disapproving look.
scene.dialogue: (a la Frogsy, the Gremlin) I'll be good, I will, I will.
Captain, he's dropping off fast. Almost seven hundred.
Striker, get back to a thousand feet!

scene.meta: Assistant Radar Operator unloads clothes from radar screen/ wash machine door and puts them into basket.
scene.dialogue: He's below seven hundred now and he's still going down! 675! 650! 625! 600!

scene.meta: It knocks the radio tower off a building and heads past the John Hancock Building.

scene.dialogue: Striker, you're coming in too low! What's your altitude?
I don't know. How high was the eighty- ninth floor of the John Hancock Building?
He's right on the heading.
All right, he's on final now! Put out all runway lights except niner.

scene.meta: Ambulance attendants, firemen, and emergency vehicles are in readiness.

scene.dialogue: Turn on your landing lights, Striker. It's the switch above your right knee.

scene.meta: Striker reaches for button above his left knee.
scene.dialogue: No. I said your right knee.
scene.meta: Striker pushes button over his right knee.
Landing lights come on.
McCroskey, Kramer, and Mrs. Oveur are nervously watching the sky.
scene.dialogue: All right, now just listen carefully. You should be able to see the runway at three hundred feet.
scene.meta: Mrs. Oveur clutches Kramer's arm anxiously.
scene.dialogue: Aim to touchdown a third of the way along. There's a slight crosswind from the right, so be ready for it.
scene.meta: Mrs. Oveur is clutching Kramer's arm with both hands.
scene.dialogue: If you land too fast, use your emergency brakes. The red handle is right in front of you.
scene.meta: Now Mrs. Oveur, still watching the sky, has both arms around Kramer's waist, massaging his chest with her hands.
scene.dialogue: If that doesn't stop you...
scene.meta: Kramer is suddenly aware of what Mrs. Oveur is doing. He gives her a look and she removes her hands.
scene.dialogue: If that doesn't stop you, cut the four ignition switches over the co-pilot's head.

scene.meta: Striker looks for switches.
INSERT - IGNITION SWITCHES

scene.dialogue: See them, Elaine?
Uh-huh.
Do you see us now? You should be able to see the field now.

scene.sceneheader: EXT. AIRPLANE - THROUGH COCKPIT WINDOW - NIGHT
scene.meta: Striker and Elaine are searching for airfield.
Kramer and McCroskey are tensely trying to spot plane. Mrs. Oveur is watching, prayerfully.
Searchlights scan field.
Revolving beacon searches.
McCROSKEY It sure is quiet out there.
scene.dialogue: Yeah -- too quiet.
scene.meta: McCROSKEY Looks like I picked the wrong week to quit sniffing glue. He pulls a tube of airplane glue from his shirt pocket and sniffs.

scene.sceneheader: EXT. AIRPLANE - THROUGH COCKPIT WINDOW - NIGHT
scene.meta: Striker and Elaine are searching for airfield.
Kramer and Mrs. Oveur are anxiously watching the sky. McCroskey is glazed.
scene.dialogue: (excited) There he is! (into microphone) Striker, you're coming in too fast!
I know! I know!
(into microphone) He knows! He knows!
scene.meta: McCROSKEY Wow!

scene.dialogue: (into microphone) Sound your alarm bell now.

scene.meta: Elaine rings alarm bell.
Alarm BELL RINGS. Randy is standing in center aisle.
scene.dialogue: All right, now, everybody get in crash positions.
scene.meta: Passengers assume various awkward poses as though plane had just crashed.
Ambulance attendants anxiously watch sky.
Striker sees airport and points it out to Elaine.
scene.dialogue: Speed is increasing.
Airspeed one twenty-five, one thirty...
scene.meta: She raises her head to look out cockpit window.
The runway lights go out.
Striker and Elaine look at each other, panicked.
Hinshaw has just pulled a plug from an electrical outlet.
scene.dialogue: Just kidding!

scene.meta: Runway lights go back on.
Striker and Elaine are relieved.
scene.dialogue: ...one thirty-five, one forty.
Striker, now listen to me. You're coming down too fast!

scene.meta: Striker is struggling with steering wheel and sweating.
scene.dialogue: Put down thirty degrees of flap!
scene.meta: Striker is sweating profusely as he struggles in vain with the flap switch.
scene.dialogue: It's stuck. It won't move!
scene.meta: He bangs the control panel and "TILT" light up.
McCroskey is staring at radio equipment.
scene.dialogue: Bring it down! Easy!
scene.meta: McCROSKEY Look at all those buttons! Oh that's beautiful! Just beautiful!

scene.dialogue: Watch your nose! It's too low!
scene.meta: Striker is struggling with wheel. The wheel begins to fight back, pushing Striker.
scene.dialogue: You're coming in too hot!
Remember your brakes and switches! Get ready to flare it out! You're coming in too fast! Watch your speed!
scene.meta: McCROSKEY (hysterical) He's coming right at us! McCroskey turns and leaps through tower window. All activity momentarily stops. Everyone looks back at window. Then activity resumes.
scene.dialogue: You're coming in too hot! Put down full flaps! Watch your nose!

scene.meta: Runway swerving underneath him.

scene.dialogue: Now ease her down! Down!

scene.meta: Plane is a few feet from ground.

scene.dialogue: Lift the nose! Throttle back!

scene.meta: Closer to ground.
Striker pushes wheel forward as tires SCREECH.

scene.dialogue: The brake! Pull the red handle!

scene.meta: Striker pulls red handle. It comes off in his hand. He pushes brake with feet.
SCREECHING.
Dr. Rumack pokes his head in the door.
scene.dialogue: I just wanted to tell you both good luck. We're all counting on you.

scene.meta: Runway passing underneath.

scene.dialogue: (into microphone) Hold her steady, hold her steady!

scene.meta: skidding.

scene.sceneheader: INT. O'HARE TERMINAL BUILDING - GATE 7 - NIGHT
scene.dialogue: You attention, please. Trans American Flight 209 non-stop from Los Angeles is now arriving at Gate seven...Gate eight...
scene.meta: People in Gate seven waiting area move to Gate eight.
is struggling with controls, sweating profusely.

scene.dialogue: Pull a lever!

scene.meta: skidding.
is struggling with controls. Water is gushing down his face ridiculously.

scene.sceneheader: INT. O'HARE TERMINAL BUILDING - GATE 13 - NIGHT
scene.dialogue: ...209 arriving gate thirteen...gate fourteen....gate fifteen...
scene.meta: People in Gate thirteen move to Gate fourteen.
skidding.

scene.dialogue: Push a button!

scene.meta: Striker is struggling with controls.

scene.dialogue: (into microphone) You're too low! You're too low!
...gate twenty-three...twenty four... twenty-five...
scene.meta: People are running THROUGH FRAME right to left.
Ground crewman with red flashlights nonchalantly directs plane. Suddenly he realizes the plane is not stopping. He throws his flashlight at the plane and runs off, terrified.
skidding.
Randy approaches a passenger in crash position.
scene.dialogue: Can we help arrange hotel accommodations or a rent-a-car during your stay in Chicago?

scene.meta: Landing gear snaps off; plane starts to slide on its belly.
scene.dialogue: is heading toward a building. On the side of the building is a billboard with a man drinking milk.

scene.meta: Elaine screams and covers her face. St. Christopher statue covers its face.
is getting closer to building. Billboard man is looking at plane, terrified.
is screaming.
is skidding.

scene.dialogue: (seated in wheelchair) Wheel me to the West Wing. I wish to view the Degas.

scene.meta: skids to a stop.
Kramer sighs in relief as controllers and Mrs. Oveur dash from room.
Controllers celebrate safe landing, reporters rush from room.
Five reporters run into bank of phone booths and the booths topple over.
SCREAMING ambulances race toward plane.
Passengers rise slowly, shaken but uninjured. Milton and Bernice look at each other, relieved, and embrace. Mrs. Schiff gets up to leave.
Rumack pokes his head in door.
scene.dialogue: I just wanted to tell you both good luck. We're all counting on you.
scene.meta: Striker and Elaine get up to leave cockpit.
scene.dialogue: Striker, Striker, are you all right?
(into microphone) Yeah, we're okay.
Ted, that was probably the lousiest landing in the history of this airport. But there are some of us here...
...particularly me, who'd like to buy you a drink and shake your hand.
scene.meta: Striker and Elaine leave.
scene.dialogue: ...and, Ted, I just want you to know, that when the going got tough up there, when the chips were down...

scene.sceneheader: INT. PASSENGER CABIN - BOARDING AREA - NIGHT
scene.meta: Randy is assisting Jack and Shirley, the Hammens, and the nun from the plane.
scene.dialogue: Hurry now. Please be careful.

scene.meta: Air controllers leave as Kramer continues.
scene.dialogue: ...Lonliness, that's the bottom line. I was never happy as a child. Christmas, Ted, what does it mean to you? For me, it was a living hell. Do you know what it's like to fall in the mud and get kicked? In the head? By an iron boot? Of course you don't. No one does. That never happens. Sorry, Ted. Dumb question. Strike that.

scene.sceneheader: INT. PASSENGER CABIN - BOARDING AREA - NIGHT
scene.meta: Randy is assisting Hari Krishnas and Black Dudes from plane.

McCroskey, dressed in wet suit and flippers and oxygen tank is moving as though swimming under water. McCROSKEY (v.o.) I didn't know that the electric eel was approaching so rapidly nor that hidden in the coral reef was a family of poisonous sea urchins.
Lisa Davis and her mother enter ambulance. It pulls from FRAME. We HEAR a loud screech and crash.
Kramer is still droning on.
scene.dialogue: (into mike) ...and they shall be for frontlets between thine eyes, Ted. Neither they man servant, nor they maid servant, nor thine ox, nor thine ass.

scene.meta: ROMANTIC MUSIC. Striker and Elaine are alone on the runway. Behind them is flight 209. They embrace and kiss as CAMERA ARCS around. MUSIC SWELLS. Suddenly the ENGINES REV UP. Astonished, they look up to the cockpit.
Automatic pilot is at controls. He salutes Striker and Elaine and winks at CAMERA.
The plane begins to taxi on its belly, shooting off sparks and making a tremendous scraping SOUND. Arm in arm, Striker and Elaine wave good-bye as the plane takes off into the night sky.
